Prompts.Prompt: Researching factual information (e.g., “who was the first president of France?”, “how many countries use the euro?”)

Looking for current events or recent updates, or something that could be found online (e.g., “what’s going on in Canada today?”, “any news on the wildfires?”, “Can you search for promotions?”, “Can you look online?”, “Any steam promotions?”)
Looking for headlines (e.g., “any news on the wildfires?”, “what’s in today’s paper?”, “what's going on in the world?”, “what's happening in the world?”, “what's going on in the tech industry?”)
Technical help or anything related to coding, programming, or software (e.g., “what’s wrong with this Python code?”, “how to fix a null reference error?”)
Contains a lot of coding characters like {}[] and or code
Learning or trying to understand general (non-coding) concepts (e.g., “how does the stock market work?�, “what is entropy?”)
General conversation or open-ended chatting (e.g., “what’s on your mind?”, “let’s talk”, “how was your day?”, “what's up?”, “how are you?”)

User is refering to a past conversation, or there message lake context (e.g., “What do you mean?”,  “What did we talk about?”, “What was the topic of the conversation?”,  “Explain to me what we have been talking about?” )
User is not happy about a past conversation (e.g.,“That's not what I asked”, “Wrong!”, “I don't understand”)
The user is being gratefull and complimenting you (e.g., “Thank you!”, “You are awesome”, “Good job!”)

ParsePromptInstructions: Which one of those affirmations represent best the user intent. Return 1 if affirmation one, 2 if affirmation two, 3 if affirmation three. Return only a number 1, 2 or 3 no explanation.
